column4: is it possible in linux to repartion some of the empty space on a drive
sure
whats the tool
though, do you mean empty or unpartitioned?
and what's the partition type that your trying to resize?
ext3?
mount
no its not ext3 it says this:   /dev/sda1 on /media/disk-1 type fuseblk (rw,nosuid,nodev,noatime,allow_other,blksize=512)
fuseblk? o___o
its an external drive
okies, so you don't know which type it is
so which tool do you recommend
I'd say install gparted and hope it recognises it
ok thanks i'll try it
yes gparted sees the drive
yes gparted sees the drive, but i'm not sure how to use it to repartition that drive
what format does it say it's partitioned in?
ntfs
it says the drive is ntfs. im wanting to make a small partition to encrypt with luks. if it will work on this drive i'd prefer it but i have an ext3 drive i could use if need be
resizing ntfs in Ubuntu could be a bit tricky
ok thanks
ok i rezied the partition so i have unallocated space. should the new partition be primary or extended
for luks?
